folder: Bay Street & Union Place, Staten Island, NY
text:
Bay Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Union Place, showing the Vanderbilt House. Here Commodore Cornelius Vanderbilt spent the years of his early manhood. The maps of 1907 and 1917 show the house to be on property belonging to Charles Rosenberg.

1924
Views 1, 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr

folder: Bay Street & Union Place, Staten Island, NY
text:
Bay Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Union Place, showing the Vanderbilt House. Commodore Cornelius Vanderbilt spent the years of his early manhood here.

About 1905

By Eugene G. Putnam.
From Staten Island Museum Collection.
Through P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, years later.

February 7, 1920

By William T. Davis through P.L.Sperr.

(3) The site of the Vanderbilt House, viewing east along the north side of Union Place from Beach to Bay Streets, and showing operations for the erection of the Paramount Building.

P.L.Sperr

February 10, 1930

folder: Bay Street & Union Place, Staten Island, NY
text:
Bay Street, at the N. W. corner of Union Place (left), showing the clearance for the Paramount Buiiding, site of the old Cornelius Vanderbilt House. On the extreme left is the Pape Building, on Union
Place.
February 9, 1930
P. 1. Sperr
(2)
Viewing northwestward across the clearance, from
Union Place.
February 9, 1930
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The Pape Building, on the south side of Union Place, seen across Bay Street and the clearance.
February 9, 1930
P. L. Sperr

folder: Bay Street & Cross Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
577 Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Cross Street, showing the Stapleton branch of the Bank of America.

June 13, 1931

P. L. Sperr
